did.unittitle: Ted Stone Collection of Lone Star Cotton Mills Photographs
did.abstract: Interior and exterior photographs of the Lone Star Cotton Mills in El Paso, Texas.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Lone Star was first founded as the El Paso Cotton Mills Company in 1923; in 1932 the company was reorganized as Lone Star Cotton Mills, Inc. The company ceased production after 1980.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Include aerial and ground-level views of the exterior of the Lone Star Cotton Mills plant in El Paso, Texas. Also includes interior views featuring drawing frames, ring spinning frames, warping machines, the winding room, and the weaving room. The photographs were taken circa 1945.

did.unittitle: Lone Star Cotton Mills, interior and exterior photos
Item 1: Exterior view of the Lone Star Cotton Mills office and plant

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, ca. 1945. Image depicts the office entrance and two-story concrete manufacturing plant of the Lone Star Cotton Mills, Inc. in El Paso, Texas. Barbed-wire fence in front; cars parked in the side yard. See item 2 in this folder for a view of the plant from the side. 25.25 x 20.5 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 2: Side view of the exterior of the Lone Star Cotton Mill office and plant

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, ca. 1945. Image depicts the office entrance (on the left) and two-story concrete manufacturing plant of the Lone Star Cotton Mills, Inc. in El Paso, Texas. Cars parked in side yard are somewhat obscured by trees. Water tower in the right background; lots of open space in the foreground. Partial railroad tracks in the left foreground. See item 1 in this folder for a closer view of the plant from the front. 25.25 x 20.5 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 3: Aerial view of Lone Star Cotton Mill

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, ca. 1940. Image depicts an aerial view of the Lone Star Cotton Mills plant in El Paso, Texas. The company consists of an office building (upper left background), a two-story concrete building with a one-story attachment, and several other buildings. Water tower is in the right foreground. Railroad cars on tracks in the upper background. One-story houses visible on the right. See item 4 in this folder for another aerial view from a different angle. 25.5 x 20.5 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 4: Aerial view of Lone Star Cotton Mills

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, ca. 1940. Image depicts an aerial view of the Lone Star Cotton Mills plant in El Paso, Texas. One-story housing visible in foreground. Water tower is on the left; company buildings in the center. Open land behind the company plant. See item 3 in this folder for another aerial view from a different angle. 25.5 x 20.5 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 5: Female employee at drawing frame

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Press Photo, J.G. Gerlach, El Paso Photo Co. Gelatin silver print, ca. 1945. Image depicts a female employee working at a drawing frame (manufactured by the Saco-Lowell Shops) in the Lone Star Cotton Mills, Inc. in El Paso, Texas. A carding machine is in the right background; a male employee brings an empty can forward. Copy B. 20.5 x 26 cm.
